name: Seafood Importers and Processors Alliance
goal:
The Seafood Importers and Processors Alliance (SIPA) is an international alliance of seafood businesses dedicated to food safety issues and legislation.

Its overarching aim is to facilitate scientific research and studies into all issues relating to food safety and food security of fishery and aquaculture products that have been imported into the European Union. In addition, it has the following functions:


Support network
SIPA members share information with each other and the wider seafood sector on the issues that affect members most: seafood safety, European trade, tariffs, supply and reputation. Members receive recommendations and support on how to overcome these issues.

Sponsored research
SIPA sponsors scientific studies to clarify issues to inform and benefit its members, their businesses and the international seafood trade.

An organisation with transparency
SIPA is self-funded and has no government or national affiliations. This allows SIPA to direct members' efforts towards improving the conditions under which seafood is produced and traded worldwide.

International connections
SIPA maintains international contacts to improve relations between European and international operators and authorities.
interests: Food Safety, Maritime affairs and fisheries, Research and innovation, Trade
euInitiatives:
Seafood trade: GSP, certificates of origin, tariffs
Seafood labelling, food information and traceability
Contaminants, chemical safety
Residues of veterinary medicines
